snippet: An Asiana jetliner from South Korea crashed and caught fire, killing two people and injuring more than 180 others.
abstract: Asiana Airlines passenger jet traveling from Seoul, South Korea, crashes while landing at San Francisco International Airport; plane smashes into pieces and catches fire, killing at least two people and injuring more than 180 others; crash comes after remarkable period of safety for airlines in the United States.

byline.original: By NORIMITSU ONISHI and RAVI SOMAIYA
byline.contributor: Norimitsu Onishi reported from San Francisco, and Ravi Somaiya from New York. Reporting was contributed by Vindu Goel, John Markoff and Somini Sengupta from San Francisco; Christopher Drew, Jad Mouawad, Marc Santora and Michael Schwirtz from New York; Matthew L. Wald from Washington; and Choe Sang-hun from Seoul, South Korea. Susan Beachy contributed research.

lead_paragraph: An Asiana jetliner from South Korea crashed and caught fire, killing two people and injuring more than 180 others.

headline.main: 2 Die and Many Are Hurt as Plane Crashes in San Francisco
headline.print_headline: 2 Die, 180 Injured As Plane Crashes In San Francisco
